channel.title: Client stops loading at "Preparing game engine"
channel.description:
Well, I have no clue what I may have done to this. It might be a problem with the cache... no clue. Anyways, I get this error in the console window.
[code] PANIC! RANDOMISED BLOCK! Exception in thread "Thread-4" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 86 at Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2.method362(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2.java:235) at Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2.method361(Class30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub2.java:217) at client.method135(client.java:9819) at client.method9(client.java:8626) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:126) at client.run(client.java:4442) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) [/code]

item.title: Client stops loading at "Preparing game engine"
item.dc:creator: @FuckYew FuckYew
item.description:
@FuckYew wrote:

Learn to read…

error_js5connect is not the error…

You send me fuckign flame messages saying I’ms tupid and you answer a stupid fucking question that isn’t even asked… Fuck off

Read full topic
item.source: Client stops loading at "Preparing game engine"

item.title: Client stops loading at "Preparing game engine"
item.dc:creator: @Reamm28 Reamm28
item.description:
@Reamm28 wrote:

If you get some error that looks sort of like error_js5connect on the cmd prompt, thats because you need to run the server then the client. error_js5connect stops the client at “preparing game engine” so that might be the problem.

If what I’ve written above is not the problem , it’s because the source and/or client have Anti-Leech. Anti-Leech prevents you from running the source and/or client by nulling it. Ask the releaser of the source to remove the Anti-Leech , then it may be able to load all the way.

What deob is that source and client?

Read full topic
item.source: Client stops loading at "Preparing game engine"
